Question: Which lenses are compatible with [Electronic full-time MF] on the EOS-1D X Mark III?

Question: How do I enable continuous autofocus on the PowerShot G9 X Mark II?

Question: How do I update the firmware on the EOS R5?

Question: What is the battery life of the PowerShot G7 X Mark III?
Answer: Approximately 265 shots (Eco mode: 320 shots) or 55 minutes of video with the NB-13L battery.

Question: How do I clean the sensor on the EOS-1D X Mark III?

Question: How do I fix an EOS Utility connection error on Windows 10?
Answer: Update EOS Utility, check USB/Wi-Fi connection, temporarily disable firewall, select [PC Connection] mode on the camera.

Question: Which lenses support high-speed continuous shooting on the EOS R6?
Answer: RF lenses like RF24-70mm f/2.8 L IS USM, EF lenses like EF70-200mm f/2.8L IS USM support 12 fps (mechanical shutter) or 20 fps (electronic shutter).

Question: What is the maximum video recording time of the PowerShot SX740 HS?
Answer: Up to 29 minutes 59 seconds per clip in Full HD or 4K, may stop earlier due to battery or card capacity.

Question: How do I enable Bluetooth on the EOS 90D?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Wireless communication settings] > [Bluetooth function], select [Smartphone], pair via the Camera Connect app.

Question: What is the Err 01 error on the EOS 5D Mark IV?
Answer: Communication error between camera and lens. Clean contacts, reattach lens, or try another lens.

Question: How do I adjust white balance on the PowerShot G7 X Mark II?

Question: What’s the difference between RF and EF lenses?
Answer: RF lenses are for mirrorless cameras, offer faster communication, compact design. EF lenses are for DSLRs, usable on R-series with an adapter.

Answer: Canon recommends genuine batteries for safety and performance. Third-party batteries may cause errors or damage.

Answer: Yes, use an adapter like Sigma MC-21, but autofocus performance may not be optimal.

Question: How do I reset the Panasonic Lumix G9 II to factory settings?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Setup] > [Reset], select [Reset All Settings], and confirm.

Question: How do I enable HDR on the Panasonic Lumix S5 II?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Rec] > [HDR], select [On] or [Auto].

Question: Why does the Panasonic Lumix GH6 overheat during video recording?
Answer: Prolonged 4K/6K recording causes overheating. Pause recording, let cool, or use a cooling fan.

Question: How do I enable continuous autofocus on the Panasonic Lumix ZS100?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Rec] > [Focus Mode], select [AFC].

Question: What is the maximum video recording time of the Panasonic Lumix S9?
Answer: Up to 30 minutes per clip in 4K, depending on battery and card capacity.

Question: How do I enable continuous shooting on the Panasonic Lumix G9 II?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Rec] > [Drive Mode], select [Burst Shot 1] or [Burst Shot 2].

Question: Why does the Panasonic Lumix FZ80 show a memory card error?
Answer: Card may be full, locked, or incompatible. Unlock, format, or use an SDHC/SDXC card.

Question: How do I adjust white balance on the Panasonic Lumix S1?
Answer: Go to [Menu] > [Rec] > [White Balance], select a mode or customize with a white object.

Question: Which RF lenses support Dual Pixel CMOS AF II on the EOS R5?
Answer: All RF lenses, including RF15-35mm f/2.8L IS USM, RF24-70mm f/2.8L IS USM, and RF70-200mm f/2.8L IS USM, support Dual Pixel CMOS AF II on the EOS R5.

Question: Can EF-S lenses be used on the Canon EOS R6 II with an adapter?
Answer: Yes, EF-S lenses can be used on the EOS R6 II with a Canon Mount Adapter EF-EOS R, but they will create a 1.6x crop factor, reducing effective resolution.

Question: Which Sony E-mount lenses support Real-time Tracking AF on the Sony a7 IV?
Answer: All Sony E-mount lenses, including FE 24-70mm f/2.8 GM II and FE 70-200mm f/2.8 GM OSS II, support Real-time Tracking AF on the a7 IV.

Question: Are Fujifilm XF lenses compatible with the Fujifilm X-T5?
Answer: Yes, all Fujifilm XF and XC lenses are fully compatible with the X-T5, such as XF 23mm f/1.4 R LM WR and XF 56mm f/1.2 R WR.

Question: Which Panasonic Lumix S lenses support 6K video recording on the Lumix S5 II?
Answer: All Lumix S lenses, including S 24-70mm f/2.8 and S 50mm f/1.8, support 6K video recording on the S5 II.

Question: Can Nikon Z-mount lenses be used on the Nikon Z6 III without an adapter?
Answer: Yes, all Nikon Z-mount lenses, such as the NIKKOR Z 24-70mm f/2.8 S, are directly compatible with the Z6 III.

Question: Which Canon EF lenses support in-body image stabilization (IBIS) on the EOS R5?
Answer: EF lenses like EF 24-70mm f/2.8L II USM benefit from IBIS on the EOS R5 with an EF-EOS R adapter, but coordinated IS requires RF lenses.

Question: Do Sony FE lenses maintain full autofocus performance on the Sony a6700?
Answer: Yes, Sony FE lenses maintain full autofocus performance on the a6700, but with a 1.5x crop factor due to the APS-C sensor.

Question: Are Fujifilm GF lenses compatible with the Fujifilm GFX 50S II?
Answer: Yes, all Fujifilm GF lenses, such as GF 32-64mm f/4 R LM WR, are fully compatible with the GFX 50S II.

Question: Which Panasonic Lumix S lenses support Dual I.S. 2 on the Lumix S1R II?
Answer: Lumix S lenses like S 24-105mm f/4 Macro O.I.S. and S 70-200mm f/4 O.I.S. support Dual I.S. 2 on the S1R II.

Question: Can Nikon F-mount lenses be used on the Nikon Z8 with an adapter?
Answer: Yes, Nikon F-mount lenses can be used on the Z8 with the FTZ II Mount Adapter, retaining autofocus and exposure control.

Question: Which Canon RF lenses support 8K video recording on the EOS R5?
Answer: All RF lenses support 8K on the EOS R5, including RF 15-35mm f/2.8L IS USM and RF 100-500mm f/4.5-7.1L IS USM.

Question: Do Sony E-mount lenses support Eye AF on the Sony a7C II?
Answer: Yes, all Sony E-mount lenses, such as FE 50mm f/1.8, support Eye AF on the a7C II.

Question: Which Fujifilm XF lenses support Linear Motor AF on the X-H2S?
Answer: XF lenses like XF 18mm f/1.4 R LM WR and XF 33mm f/1.4 R LM WR support Linear Motor AF on the X-H2S.

Question: Are Panasonic Lumix S lenses compatible with the Leica SL3 via L-mount?
Answer: Yes, all Lumix S lenses are compatible with the Leica SL3 via the L-mount alliance, retaining full functionality.

Question: Which Nikon Z lenses support 4K 120p video recording on the Nikon Z9?
Answer: All Nikon Z lenses, including NIKKOR Z 70-200mm f/2.8 VR S, support 4K 120p on the Z9.

Question: Can Canon RF-S lenses be used on the EOS R5?
Answer: Yes, RF-S lenses can be used on the EOS R5, but they create a 1.6x crop factor, reducing resolution to about 17.3MP.

Question: Which Sony FE lenses support 120fps continuous shooting on the Sony a1?
Answer: FE lenses like FE 70-200mm f/2.8 GM OSS II and FE 24-70mm f/2.8 GM II support 120fps on the a1.

Question: Do Fujifilm XC lenses work with the Fujifilm X-S20?
Answer: Yes, all Fujifilm XC lenses, such as XC 15-45mm f/3.5-5.6 OIS PZ, are fully compatible with the X-S20.

Question: Which Panasonic Lumix S lenses support High Resolution mode on the S5 IIX?
Answer: All Lumix S lenses, including S 85mm f/1.8, support High Resolution mode on the S5 IIX for up to 96MP stills.

Question: Are Nikon Z DX lenses compatible with the Nikon Z7 II?
Answer: Yes, Z DX lenses like NIKKOR Z DX 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 VR work on the Z7 II with a 1.5x crop factor.

Question: Which Canon EF lenses support Eye Detection AF on the EOS R6 with an adapter?
Answer: EF lenses like EF 85mm f/1.8 USM and EF 70-200mm f/2.8L IS II USM support Eye Detection AF on the EOS R6 via an EF-EOS R adapter.

Question: Do Sony E-mount APS-C lenses work on the Sony a7R V?
Answer: Yes, E-mount APS-C lenses work on the a7R V with a 1.5x crop factor, reducing resolution to about 26MP.

Question: Which Fujifilm GF lenses support 8K video recording on the GFX 100 II?
Answer: All GF lenses, including GF 45mm f/2.8 R WR, support 8K video on the GFX 100 II.

Question: Can Panasonic Lumix G lenses be used on the Lumix S5 II with an adapter?
Answer: No, Lumix G (Micro Four Thirds) lenses are not compatible with the S5 II (L-mount), even with an adapter, due to different mounts.

Question: Which Nikon F-mount lenses support autofocus on the Nikon Zf with the FTZ II adapter?
Answer: F-mount AF-S and AF-P lenses, like AF-S NIKKOR 50mm f/1.8G, support autofocus on the Zf with the FTZ II adapter.

Question: Which Canon RF lenses support the Control Ring function on the EOS R6?
Answer: All RF lenses with a control ring, like RF 24-105mm f/4L IS USM, support customizable Control Ring functions on the EOS R6.

Question: Are Sony FE lenses compatible with the Sony FX3 for video recording?
Answer: Yes, all Sony FE lenses, including FE 16-35mm f/2.8 GM, are fully compatible with the FX3 for video.

Question: Do Fujifilm XF lenses support weather sealing on the X-T50?
Answer: Only weather-sealed XF lenses, like XF 16-55mm f/2.8 R LM WR, provide weather resistance when paired with the X-T50.

Question: Which Panasonic L-mount lenses support Dual I.S. 5-axis on the Lumix S1H?
Answer: Lumix S lenses like S 24-70mm f/2.8 and S 70-200mm f/2.8 O.I.S. support Dual I.S. 5-axis on the S1H.

Question: Can Nikon Z lenses be used on the Nikon D850 with an adapter?
Answer: No, Nikon Z lenses cannot be used on the D850, as there is no adapter for Z-mount lenses on F-mount DSLRs.

Question: Which Canon RF lenses support Nano USM for fast focusing on the EOS R5?

Question: Do Sony E-mount lenses support Active SteadyShot on the Sony ZV-E1?
Answer: Yes, all E-mount lenses support Active SteadyShot on the ZV-E1, enhancing video stabilization.

Question: Which Fujifilm XF lenses support 40fps shooting on the X-H2?

Answer: Yes, Lumix S lenses are fully compatible with Sigma L-mount cameras like Sigma fp L via the L-mount alliance.

Question: Which Nikon Z lenses support Eye-Detection AF on the Z6 III?
Answer: All Nikon Z lenses, such as NIKKOR Z 85mm f/1.8 S, support Eye-Detection AF on the Z6 III.

Question: Can Canon EF-M lenses be used on the EOS R6 with an adapter?
Answer: No, EF-M lenses are not compatible with the EOS R6, even with adapters, due to different mount designs.

Question: Which Sony FE lenses support Breathing Compensation on the Sony a7 IV?

Question: Do Fujifilm GF lenses support Phase Detection AF on the GFX 100S?
Answer: Yes, all GF lenses, including GF 80mm f/1.7 R WR, support Phase Detection AF on the GFX 100S.

Question: Which Panasonic Lumix S lenses support 4K 60p video recording on the S5 II?
Answer: All S lenses, like S 20-60mm f/3.5-5.6, support 4K 60p on the S5 II.

Question: Are Nikon F-mount lenses compatible with the Nikon Z50 with an adapter?
Answer: Yes, F-mount lenses are compatible with the Z50 via the FTZ II adapter, but some older lenses may have limited functionality.

Question: Which Canon RF lenses support 5-axis IBIS on the EOS R6?
Answer: All RF lenses, such as RF 28-70mm f/2L USM, support 5-axis IBIS on the EOS R6, enhancing stabilization with IS-equipped lenses.

Question: Do Sony E-mount lenses support Animal Eye AF on the Sony a7R IV?
Answer: Yes, all E-mount lenses, including FE 200-600mm f/5.6-6.3 G OSS, support Animal Eye AF on the a7R IV.

Question: Which Fujifilm XF lenses support macro shooting on the X-T4?
Answer: XF lenses like XF 80mm f/2.8 R LM OIS WR Macro and XF 60mm f/2.4 R Macro are designed for macro shooting on the X-T4.

Question: Can Panasonic Lumix S lenses be used on the Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Pro?
Answer: Yes, Lumix S lenses can be used on the Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 6K Pro with an L-mount adapter.

Question: Which Nikon Z lenses support weather sealing on the Z8?
Answer: Z lenses like NIKKOR Z 24-120mm f/4 S and NIKKOR Z 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6 VR S are weather-sealed on the Z8.

Question: Which Canon EF lenses support Servo AF on the EOS R5 with an adapter?
Answer: EF lenses like EF 70-200mm f/2.8L IS III USM support Servo AF on the EOS R5 via an EF-EOS R adapter.

Question: Are Sony FE lenses compatible with the Sony a9 III for high-speed shooting?
Answer: Yes, all FE lenses, including FE 300mm f/2.8 GM OSS, support high-speed shooting up to 120fps on the a9 III.

Question: Do Fujifilm XF lenses support film simulation modes on the X-E4?
Answer: Yes, all XF lenses, like XF 35mm f/1.4 R, support film simulation modes on the X-E4 for consistent color reproduction.

Question: Which Panasonic L-mount lenses support Real-time LUT on the Lumix S5 IIX?
Answer: All Lumix S lenses, including S 35mm f/1.8, support Real-time LUT for video on the S5 IIX.
